title.narrative: Secondary and tertiary referral care for priority cases of war-wounded including supporting priority medical referrals from the eastern and western borders.

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to support secondary and tertiary referral care for priority cases of war-wounded including supporting priority medical referrals from the eastern and western borders. This will be achieved through referral for surgical stabilization and medical intervention, provision of medical consultation and follow-ups for the war injured at JPS Medical and Emergency Center as well as JPS network hospitals during hospitalization.
JPS project team will provide free referral for priority cases of war-wounded including supporting priority medical referrals from the eastern and western borders.
JPS project team will provide case management services for the patients along with postoperative and inpatient rehabilitation. In addition, medical follow-ups and psychosocial support sessions will be provided for the war wounded patients during their hospitalization period by the JPS medical team .
Moreover, JPS medical team will provide medical consultation and follow-ups for war wounded cases medical as well minor medical procedures at JPS EMC in Amman.
The project will cover 52 war wounded cases during the project duration that need surgical intervention of multiple injury neurosurgical, acute abdominal and chest, vascular, Maxillo-facial and eye injury cases through coordination with war wounded operational agencies. Medical emergency aid and dressing kit will be provided for the treated war wounded cases at JPS EMC and JPS networ hospitals as needed.
JPS EMC team will cover 200 follow-up services of war wounded hospitalized cases, in addition to around 150 Psycho-social support– rehabilitation sessions.
JPS medical and project team, as the Case Manager will work jointly with the health adviser to provide Case Management and Protection services for the patients, along with provision of postoperative and inpatient rehabilitation. During the hospitalization period a follow up for war wounded patients will be provided by the GP and nurse, as well as Psychosocial support – rehabilitation sessions will be provided for the cases by Psychologists on a 3 days per week. In addition, JPS medical team will provide medical consultation for war wounded cases who are in needs for constructive surgery or medical follow up as well as will provide for them minor procedures at JPS EMC at Amman.
The project during the six months will cover 52 war wounded cases that need surgical intervention of multiple injury neurosurgical, acute abdominal and chest, vascular, Maxillo-facial and eye injury cases through coordination with MSF, UNHCR and other NGOs. A first aid and dressing kit will be provided for the war wounded treated cases at JPS EMC amp Hospitals network, as the kit will hold the basic and comprehensive needs.
JPS EMC team will cover 200 follow-up services of war wounded hospitalized cases, in addition to around 150 Psycho-social support– rehabilitation sessions.
